content: Jie Zhang (Student Member, IEEE) received the M.S. degree in computer application technology from the Yunnan Normal University in 2022. He is currently working toward the Ph.D. degree in computer science and technology with the Tianjin University. His research interests include efficient and secure data sharing within blockchain systems.
summary: Jie Zhang (Student Member, IEEE) received the M.S. degree in computer application technology from the Yunnan Normal University in 2022. He is currently working toward the Ph.D. degree in computer science and technology with the Tianjin University.
title: Jie Zhang

content:
Flexibility This feature can be used for publishing content such as:
Online courses Project or software documentation Tutorials The courses folder may be renamed. For example, we can rename it to docs for software/project documentation or tutorials for creating an online course.
Delete tutorials To remove these pages, delete the courses folder and see below to delete the associated menu link.
Update site menu After renaming or deleting the courses folder, you may wish to update any [[main]] menu links to it by editing your menu configuration at config/_default/menus.toml.
For example, if you delete this folder, you can remove the following from your menu configuration:
[[main]] name = "Courses" url = "courses/" weight = 50 Or, if you are creating a software documentation site, you can rename the courses folder to docs and update the associated Courses menu configuration to:
[[main]] name = "Docs" url = "docs/" weight = 50 Update the docs menu If you use the docs layout, note that the name of the menu in the front matter should be in the form [menu.X] where X is the folder name. Hence, if you rename the courses/example/ folder, you should also rename the menu definitions in the front matter of files within courses/example/ from [menu.example] to [menu.<NewFolderName>].
summary: Learn how to use Academic's docs layout for publishing online courses, software documentation, and tutorials.
title: Overview

title: 2407: Congratulations! Our 2 softwritings have been successfully authorised

title: 2405: 1 of our patents has been successfully accepted!

summary: Project workshop of the National Key Research and Development Programme ‘Research and Development of Flexible Big Data Cloud Platform Support System for Large Inter-cohort Joint Research’.

content: The patent filed on 16 Aug 22 has been successfully granted on 23 Feb 2024, congratulations!

title: 2402: Congratulations! 1 of our patents has been successfully granted

summary: Report on the progress of the three internal units of Project 2 ‘Research on Cross-queue Data Security Sharing Mechanism and Trusted Analysis Technology’.

summary: Lakes, Predictive models, Biological system modeling, Temperature sensors, Water monitoring, Land surface temperature.
title: Prediction of surface water temperature and its spatial-temporal variation characteristics of 11 main lakes in Yunnan-Guizhou Plateau

content: Completion of patent acceptance on 26 May 2023, congratulations!
summary: Application No. "202310606928.3"
title: 2305 :1 of our patents has been successfully accepted!

summary: Report on the progress of the research on ‘Cross-queue Data Security Sharing Mechanism and Trusted Analysis Technology’ in Topic II.
title: Cross-queue Healthcare Data Security Management Platform Demo

content:
This paper focuses on edge security. Based on ECDSA, edge computing is introduced in master-slave chain scenarios to achieve secure and trusted authentication, giving the cross-domain access model and authentication process.
**Congratulations!!! **
Until November 2023, our paper was selected as CNKI’s highly downloaded paper
summary: Edge Computing, Block Multichain, Cross Domain, Authentication, Trust Management
title: Secure and Trusted Authentication Models under Edge Computing and Block Multi-Chaining

content: During his master’s degree, as a technical backbone, he led four master’s students to participate in the application of this national nature project, and after this project was successfully declared, he participated in the project as the first student and completed an invention patent.
summary: A Searchable Cross-Domain Access Model for the Edge Internet of Things (IoT) Based on Block Multichain (6226070857)
title: National Natural Geoscience Project

content: During his PhD, as a technical backbone, he led one doctoral student, six master’s students and five undergraduates to successfully complete the project advancement of the National Key Research and Development Programme ‘Research on Cross-queue Data Security Sharing Mechanism and Trusted Analysis Technology’.
summary: Research on Cross-queue Data Security Sharing Mechanism and Trusted Analysis Technology (2021YFF1201102)
title: National Key Research and Development Programme

summary: Lightweight Blockchain, Edge Computing, Internet of Things (IoT), Access control, Attribute-based encryption, Security.
title: A lightweight blockchain-based access control scheme for integrated edge computing in the internet of things

summary: urban heat island; UAS TIR; remote sensing; land covers; thermal runoff; LSWT.
title: Urban Land Surface Temperature Monitoring and Surface Thermal Runoff Pollution Evaluation Using UAV Thermal Remote Sensing Technology

content:
This paper is about Internet of Things (IoT) security. An attempt is made to implement Access control based on Blockchain in Cloud-Edge-End architecture and a SC-ABAC model and a simple prototype is given.SC-ABAC is a Smart Contract for Attribute Based Access control with improved POW consensus algorithm in the prototype.
**Congratulations!!! **
Until November 2023, our paper was selected as a Highly Cited and Highly Downloaded paper in CKI!
summary: Internet of Things (IoT); Edge Computing; Blockchain; Access Control; Attribute Access; Signature Authentication
title: ‘Access control model for Internet of Things (IoT) based on blockchain and edge computing’

content: During his master’s degree, as a technical backbone, he led four master’s students to participate in the writing of this provincial special application, and after the successful declaration of this project, he participated in the project as the first student and published CNKI highly cited and highly downloadable papers one.
summary: Research on Blockchain-based Edge Access Control Model for Internet of Things (IoT) (202101AT070098)
title: Top-level Project in Yunnan Province

content: As a project leader during his master’s degree, he led five master’s students to complete this university-level science and innovation project.
summary: Blockchain-based Access control model for edge nodes of Internet of Things (IoT) (ysdyjs2020148)
title: School Science and Innovation Project

content:
Create slides in Markdown with Academic Academic | Documentation
Features Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides Controls Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click PDF Export: E Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...") Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}} Press Space to play!
One **Two** Three A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}} Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view Themes black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}} Custom CSS Example Let’s make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; } Questions? Ask
Documentation
summary: An introduction to using Academic's Slides feature.
title: Slides
